alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 02 at 12:37PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: .Rain and melting snow through Thursday will contribute to rises on creeks and streams in north Idaho. Rock slides and mudslides in steep terrain may also be possible. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah, Kootenai, Latah and Shoshone. * WHEN...Until noon PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1135 AM PST, Rain and snowmelt is occurring, and will cause minor flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
